definition: content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere
nest/pit or hollow on the human body/lair/den/place/to harbor or shelter/to hold in check/to bend/classifier for litters and broods

sentences.english: This fear confined me to a narrow comfort zone.
sentences.chinese: 恐惧心理把我局限在狭窄的安乐窝里动弹不得。

sentences.english: I recommend people to get the hell out of your comfort zone and experience the other side.
sentences.chinese: 我建议人们离开安乐窝，去到另一个世界体验一下。

sentences.english: It is hard to change because of the comfort zone.
sentences.chinese: 因为安乐窝的存在，它是很难改变。

sentences.english: Of course, push yourself out of your comfort zone; that’s the only way to learn.
sentences.chinese: 当然，学习的唯一方法是把自己从安乐窝里拽出来。

sentences.english: Describe the new and expanded comfort zone this places you in.
sentences.chinese: 描述这个你进来的新的和扩大的安乐窝的地方。

definition: to give shelter from the wind and rain/to keep out the elements
to settle down/to set up a home
to make one's home in a place/to settle
to make one's home/to take shelter
stable household, established profession (idiom); settled and comfortably off
lit. to avoid the wind/fig. to keep low to avoid a difficult situation/to stay out of trouble
to live in peace and work happily (idiom)
to find a place where one can fit in/to make one's home/to seek shelter
settle down and get on with one's pursuit
